synthesized_claims.statement: 3:** The therapeutic index is ~10-15 (ED50 plasticity ~3-5 mg oral psilocybin; TD50 destabilization ~40-60 mg), consistent with FDA TI ≥ 10 prior, and this ratio is governed by the ~3-5× concentration gap between Gq EC50 and β-arrestin 2 EC50 at 5-HT2A.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Functional selectivity window: Gq pathway EC50 ~5-10 nM psilocin vs. β-arrestin 2 recruitment EC50 ~30-60 nM; the dose ratio maps onto the TI via standard Hill occupancy (n≈1).
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Quantitative bias plots (Kenakin method) showing <2-fold separation between Gq and β-arrestin 2 transduction coefficients for psilocin at 5-HT2A.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: 3:** The therapeutic index is ~10-15 (ED50 plasticity ~3-5 mg oral psilocybin; TD50 destabilization ~40-60 mg), consistent with FDA TI ≥ 10 prior, and this ratio is governed by the ~3-5× concentration gap between Gq EC50 and β-arrestin 2 EC50 at 5-HT2A.

synthesized_claims.statement: 2:** Above ~60% occupancy, β-arrestin 2 recruitment increases supralinearly due to cooperative binding at 5-HT2A/mGluR2 heterodimers, uncoupling mGluR2 inhibitory signaling and producing excessive layer V cortical glutamate release.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: High-occupancy conformational states expose β-arrestin 2 binding epitopes on the 5-HT2A intracellular domain; β-arrestin 2 scaffolding disrupts Gi-coupled mGluR2 within the heterodimer, removing the homeostatic brake on thalamocortical glutamate.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Showing that β-arrestin 2 knockout mice still exhibit high-dose perceptual destabilization (head-twitch dose-response plateau absent), or that mGluR2 positive allosteric modulators fail to rescue high-dose adverse effects.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: 2:** Above ~60% occupancy, β-arrestin 2 recruitment increases supralinearly due to cooperative binding at 5-HT2A/mGluR2 heterodimers, uncoupling mGluR2 inhibitory signaling and producing excessive layer V cortical glutamate release.

synthesized_claims.statement: 4:** Psilocin’s Ki at 5-HT2A is 6–25 nM (pKi 7.6–8.2), with low doses (1–10 mg) yielding plasma concentrations of 2–20 nM (~10–60% occupancy) and high doses (>25 mg) reaching 100–500 nM (>80–95% occupancy).
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Competitive binding at 5-HT2A follows standard occupancy theory (Hill coefficient ~1), with plasma [psilocin] directly predicting receptor saturation.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: PET scans showing occupancy >60% at <10 mg doses, or Ki measurements outside 6–25 nM range.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: 4:** Psilocin’s Ki at 5-HT2A is 6–25 nM (pKi 7.6–8.2), with low doses (1–10 mg) yielding plasma concentrations of 2–20 nM (~10–60% occupancy) and high doses (>25 mg) reaching 100–500 nM (>80–95% occupancy).

synthesized_claims.statement: 1:** Therapeutic neuroplasticity occurs at ~15-50% 5-HT2A occupancy, where Gq/11-PLC-IP3/DAG signaling dominates, activating mTOR-dependent BDNF expression and dendritic spine growth in prefrontal cortex.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: At moderate occupancy, psilocin stabilizes a Gq-preferring receptor conformation; calcium transients via IP3 activate CaMKII→mTOR→BDNF translation without saturating network inhibition.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Demonstrating that Gq-biased 5-HT2A agonists (e.g., 25CN-NBOH with Gq bias) fail to produce neuroplasticity at equivalent occupancy, or that mTOR inhibition (rapamycin) does not block psilocybin's plasticity effects. (Note: Ly et al. 2018 showed rapamycin blocks psychedelic-induced spinogenesis, supporting this.)
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: 1:** Therapeutic neuroplasticity occurs at ~15-50% 5-HT2A occupancy, where Gq/11-PLC-IP3/DAG signaling dominates, activating mTOR-dependent BDNF expression and dendritic spine growth in prefrontal cortex.

synthesized_claims.statement: 4:** Psilocin Ki at 5-HT2A is 6-25 nM (pKi ~7.6-8.2), and with Hill coefficient ~1 (non-cooperative single-site), occupancy follows standard hyperbolic kinetics—the apparent nonlinearity at ~60% is an emergent property of downstream pathway coupling, not receptor binding itself.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Binding is Langmuir-hyperbolic (n=1 per prior); the threshold effect arises from cooperative β-arrestin 2 signaling amplification, not cooperative binding.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Radioligand binding showing Hill slope significantly >1 for psilocin at 5-HT2A. ───
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: 4:** Psilocin Ki at 5-HT2A is 6-25 nM (pKi ~7.6-8.2), and with Hill coefficient ~1 (non-cooperative single-site), occupancy follows standard hyperbolic kinetics—the apparent nonlinearity at ~60% is an emergent property of downstream pathway coupling, not receptor binding itself.

synthesized_claims.statement: Therapeutic index TD50/ED50 ≈12 (ED50_plasticity ~5 mg psilocybin; TD50_destab ~60 mg), exceeding FDA prior >10.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Therapeutic index TD50/ED50 ≈12 (ED50_plasticity ~5 mg psilocybin; TD50_destab ~60 mg), exceeding FDA prior >10.

synthesized_claims.statement: 5 (SPECULATIVE):** CYP3A4 inhibition by CBD (threshold = 1.0 µM) may indirectly widen psilocybin’s therapeutic window by reducing psilocin metabolism, but this effect is negligible at typical CBD doses (PRIOR: CBD_therapeutic_window = 1–10 µM).
synthesized_claims.mechanism: CBD-mediated CYP3A4 inhibition could prolong psilocin’s half-life, but plasma CBD rarely exceeds 1 µM in clinical settings, limiting practical impact.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: PK studies showing no change in psilocin clearance with co-administered CBD at 1–10 µM. --- ###
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: 5 (SPECULATIVE):** CYP3A4 inhibition by CBD (threshold = 1.0 µM) may indirectly widen psilocybin’s therapeutic window by reducing psilocin metabolism, but this effect is negligible at typical CBD doses (PRIOR: CBD_therapeutic_window = 1–10 µM).

synthesized_claims.statement: 2: The singular thread for psilocin Ki (6-25 nM) is valid
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: 2: The singular thread for psilocin Ki (6-25 nM) is valid
